simulator.framework
Interface TimeSensitive

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractInterval, BERFaultModel, BlackoutFaultModel, CANNetwork, CarButtonLight, CarWeightSensor, Controller, DoorMotor, DoorReversalSensor, DriveObject, FaultInjector, HallButtonLight, Interval, MessageInjector, NetworkScheduler, NetworkScheduler.Connection.RepeatedPayload, NetworkUtilization, PassengerInjector, PhysicalNetwork, PhysicalNetwork.EventPrinter, PhysicalNetwork.EventSender, ProgressLogger, RuntimeMonitor, Safety, SampleDispatcherMonitor, SamplePerformanceMonitor
public interface TimeSensitive

Allows simulator components to execute at specified time intervals. Classes that want to act as handlers for Timer objects must implement this interface.

See Also:
AbstractTimer, Timer, SystemTimer

Method Summary
 void timerExpired(java.lang.Object callbackData)
          Called when a Timer expires.
 

Method Detail

timerExpired

void timerExpired(java.lang.Object callbackData)
Called when a Timer expires.

Parameters:
callbackData - the value that was passed to Timer#start(long,Object), or null if Timer#start(long) was called instead.
